definition: to take up (one's time etc)/to occupy (one's attention etc)/to account for (a proportion of sth)
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I used to run my own business and it took all my time.
sentences.chinese: 我过去一直有自己的生意，那占去了我所有的时间。

sentences.english: Though it took us some time to help him, we were happy anyway.
sentences.chinese: 尽管帮助他占去了我们一些时间，我们还是很高兴。

sentences.english: These chat rooms take up a lot of my time.
sentences.chinese: 这些聊天室占去了我大量时间。

sentences.english: All seats have been inhabited by students.
sentences.chinese: 所有的座位都被学生们占去了。

sentences.english: Television is a one-eyed monster that has occupied almost all our spare time.
sentences.chinese: 电视是头几乎占去了我们全部业余生活的独眼恶魔。

sentences.english: This job absorbs all of my time.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作占去了我的全部时间。

sentences.english: Visitors trenched on all his time last Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 上星期天，来访的客人们占去了他的全部时间。

sentences.english: Air travel and advertising make up the biggest expenses, said Amitabh Sinha, the national convenor (a sort of campaign manager) for the Bhartiya Janta Party.
sentences.chinese: 航空旅行和广告占去开销的大头。

sentences.english: These activities occupied most of her time.
sentences.chinese: 这些活动占去了她的大部分时间。

sentences.english: Traditional paintings occupy most of the wall-space in the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 传统绘画占去了美术馆的大部分墙面。

sentences.english: Now they may not take up the whole width.
sentences.chinese: 现在它们可能没有占去整个宽度。

sentences.english: The rent gobbles up half his earnings.
sentences.chinese: 租金一项就占去他一半的收入。

sentences.english: However, all the best mooring were occupied by local fishing boats.
sentences.chinese: 凡是可以泊船的地方早已被当地渔船占去了。

definition: to seize/to push aside and occupy
to occupy by force/to seize/to dominate
to make (some time or space) available (for sb)
to have/to own/to hold/to occupy/to possess/to account for (a high proportion etc)
to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
